name: Skillet Corn Bread
author: mjgreenaway
summary: A simple, slightly sweet corn bread made in the versatile cast-iron skillet. Tastes great and is a good base recipe to experiment with. Cast-iron skillets take a little bit of time to warm up.  Pre-warming the skillet allows the corn bread to cook evenly.
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Place 9-inch cast-iron skillet in oven to warm it
Mix milk and cornmeal together in small bowl and let soak for 10 minutes
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together in a mixing bowl
Beat cornmeal mixture, eggs, and butter into the flour mixture until you have a smooth batter, about 1 minute
Swish vegetable oil in the skillet to coat; pour off excess
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 18 to 23 minutes
